intro: Manisuris cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical manisuris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
